TEI.2.document_title: J. F. Buchetti to S. M. Williams, 11-08-1827

barker_notes.barker_summary: J. F. Buchetti to S. M. Williams, November 8, 1827. Will not be priest for the colony, but Austin wishes him to teach Spanish there.

*div1 type="summary"* *p*J. F. Buchetti to S. M. Williams, November 8, 1827. Will not be priest for the colony, but Austin wishes him to teach Spanish there.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**p*Hacienda de Carrizal*/p*, the *date_mentioned n="09-08-1827">8th 9ber 1827*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Mr. Samuel W. Williams*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*Dear Sir I have received your esteemed of the*date_mentioned n="09-10-1827"> 10th of September*/date_mentioned* by the way of *person_mentioned*Mr. Ybarra */person_mentioned*and to which I answer albut immediately. I learn in it, that you are very busy, and that the *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned* has sufered a good deal of feaver, and that you have wrote to your *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*for the seeds in question etc *person_mentioned*Colonel Austin*/person_mentioned* is here, en *location_mentioned*Saltillo*/location_mentioned*, and has talked with *person_mentioned*Ybarra */person_mentioned*on the subject of the seeds, and I too, I had three large conversations with him on the subject of my former letters to him advising him that I had renounced my project of going to the *location_mentioned*brazos*/location_mentioned*, as a *person_mentioned*minister*/person_mentioned*, etc he upon the whole, was very satisfied with me. But he told me that he should be glad if I would go thither to establish a *location_mentioned*Spanish school,*/location_mentioned* that he had solicited a *person_mentioned*Spanish Master */person_mentioned*for that purpose in the *location_mentioned*U. S.*/location_mentioned* and could obtain none, that, at his arrival, he will try, (according to his wishes) to form a *location_mentioned*school*/location_mentioned*, to Justify a *person_mentioned*teacher*/person_mentioned*, and he would write me the result, and that in the meantime I would continue to write you both from time to time. As he has told me that you take the *location_mentioned*News paper called the Eagle*/location_mentioned*, I shall tell you nothing of politics because you will see in that paper all what is passing of interesting; altho I might advise you to discontinue the subscription of that one to subscribe to *location_mentioned*the Sun*/location_mentioned* which is better and cheaper.*/p*
*p*Since I have left *location_mentioned*Saltillo */location_mentioned*I was told by a good *person_mentioned*authority */person_mentioned*that the *person_mentioned*Provisor */person_mentioned*has named a *person_mentioned*priest */person_mentioned*to go to yours parts, and the *person_mentioned*Colonel*/person_mentioned* told me he would go and see him on the subject.*/p*
*p*This, Dear sir, is all what I can write worth of your notice, seing that the *person_mentioned*Colonel */person_mentioned*will inform you of all and he will not difer his return—in the meantime I remain your very respectfull and obedient servant*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Juan Francisco Buchetti*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*N. B. if through leasure you oblige me to write me again Dirrect me your letters through *person_mentioned*Mr Ybarra*/person_mentioned* as you have done this last one*/p* *p**person_mentioned*J. F. B.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
